fields.summary: I am getting email spammed, and this error

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47071]. {panel} I created an answer and I wanted to edit it to add some more information. I got a 500 error. 500 Server Error Sorry, you've encountered a system error. Back to previous page See latest questions File a bug report The question was https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/104357/let-a-user-see-only-data-from-1-specif-project?page=1#comment-104370 edit An inspection of the edit link gave me this information. edit
fields.summary: Getting a 500 error when trying to edit an answer that I created.
Answers should return error message when trying to accep maximum answer treshold
Answers Signup link is 404'ing
CSS issue with minimum-height Answer, comment overlaps downvote and best accept icons
Change settings.py-production admin email
Unable to update the profile page with a new image from Google Chrome
Instabanning while the spammer is creating an answer can leave the spam message viewable

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47060].
  {panel}

[~npellow] posted a link to https://fisheye1.atlassian.com/qsearch?q=%5B~&t=6&s=0 page, but actual link is double encoded, %5B gets converted into %255B.
Tried fixing that, specified explicitely link URL and title in the edit link popup.  In preview mode link seems fine, but after saving review rendered link is still broken.
Had to workaround by using http://go.atlassian.com/fisheye-mention-search  link.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47048].
  {panel}

My first time posting an answer I did not have a display name set so it was blank. I posted an answer then I realized it posted my real name. I so quickly went to my profile to see if I could change my real name. I see that a new required field "Display Name" was added. So I added my alias and went back to the post hoping that it would be updated correctly. My real name was still shown. So I deleted my comment and reposted it thinking it was a cache issue. Even after making a new post the alias was not used.

So as a work around I changed my real name to my alias so now my real name and alias is the set to my alias.

BTW you should note that there is a note that says your personal information will never be shown to the public or something to that effect. THIS IS A LIE as my information WAS exposed.

Just so you have additional information here is my post:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/160328/json-parse-error-on-atlassian

I also just noticed that my real name is still stored and displayed on hover of my name and when you click my name the URL is my name 

https://answers.atlassian.com/users/40704/<FIRST>%20<LAST>/

This unacceptable. I am going to delete my account from answers until this is fixed. My privacy has been violated

  {panel}

To reproduce:

1) add a comment to invoke the editor;
2) paste some URL and press 'space' to turn it into a link
3) attempt to modify the text of the link by:
     a) putting the cursor in the link text
     b) clicking on the 'link' icon
     c) reading the 'Title' (FAILS: there is no text in the 'Title')
     d) setting the 'Title' and clicking 'OK' (FAILS: the link text is not updated
4) swear a bit and wonder how the company which made Confluence could make this.

*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47027].
{panel}
Hi !
 I am writing this email to let you know of a Stored XSS Vulnerability that i found on atlassian.com .
 You will have the POC as an atachment to this report that i am making.

Now i will show you in details how i managed to find this vulnerability.
 Firstly I created an account in atlassian.com . When i created my account i set the full name to : "><svg/onload=confirm(document.domain)>;
 Then under my services, i went to [https://answers.atlassian.com/] 
 and when the page fully loaded, the javascript payload that was in my full name was executed and i got the result shown in the attachment image. 
 I also uploaded another image as an atachment showing to you the user cookies which you can get by just replacing document.domain with document.cookie on the payload.

Regards,
 Andi

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47021].
  {panel}

User content uploaded onto answers.atlassian.com is indexable by Google due to the lack of appropriate indexing rules such as those in /robots.txt.

Additionally, such content being indexed can be removed from Google by consulting Google's Webmaster tools.

An example of indexable content is below:

Search Query: site:https://answers.atlassian.com/upfiles + password
Image of results:
!http://i.imgur.com/lj8TZdY.png!

The security risk of this is quite low, however, if sensitive files do lie in /upfiles, they have been indexed by Google and will be easier to find by attackers.

h3.Summary:

This access should be restricted.

h3. Actual Results
Public users have access to this page.

When not signed in, up-voting a request pops up a nice box prompting for login...link to create account takes you to another nice box to collect needed info...and then it dies:
FF 10.0.2 = nothing happens...at all (my FF is super locked-down so who knows).

Chrome 17.0.963.56 and Safari 5.1.1: spits out a 75% hidden message in the upper left hand corner.  Can't read it, but clicking the button (can only read the last letter "k") or not clicking it and refreshing, yields nothing.  Clicking on it does trigger some sort of failed event loop as the next time you click on vote up, it throws the message:
Sorry but anonymous users cannot vote.
Please login or create an account here.
and clicking the "here" sends you off to the proper sign-up page.

Ref. screenshot for better description.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46989].
  {panel}

*Update*:
We've now published a guide for marketing a plugin:
https://developer.atlassian.com/display/MARKET/Plugin+Marketing

We've previously encouraged plugin vendors to use the forums to advertise their plugins - and it makes sense for them to have a place where they can do this. Unfortunately, this doesn't map so well to Answers - e.g. https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/2278/free-requirement-management-for-jira-studio .
